intro: Brachystegia stipulata var. quarrei, commonly known as the African brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical rainforests of Central and East Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant has a straight trunk and a broad, rounded crown, with bipinnate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically yellow or white, and it produces woody pods that contain several seeds. This species plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
